issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Index creation on a skew table fails

comments.body: Review: https://reviews.apache.org/r/14890/

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:

This message is automatically generated.

org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestCliDriver.testCliDriver_index_creation
This test failed because SerDeInfo object is not initialized correctly in patch. Attached the updated patch.

org.apache.hadoop.hive.cli.TestCliDriver.testCliDriver_infer_bucket_sort_convert_join
The test failed in setup but I don't see any error info in logs. Also I am able to run it successfully on my machine.

org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.snapshot.lock.TestWriteLock.testRun
This seems to be a failure in starting the mini ZK server and doesn't look related to the change in this bug. Again this runs successfully on my machine.

Sorry for the terrible error message. I need to improve this.  That means all nodes went bad during testing.  I am monitoring and will re-submit your patch for another round of testing.

Hi Brock, 

Its alright. This patch is still pending review. Before resubmitting the path for testing, could you please review it https://reviews.apache.org/r/14890/?

Thanks
Venki

ATTACHMENT ID: 12681441 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
authorization_index.q failure is related to the change. Will upload a new patch soon.
you can just update .q.out file.

Differences is .out files are:

{noformat}
< Num Buckets:        	0                   	 
---
> Num Buckets:        	-1                  	 
45a46,47
> Storage Desc Params:	 	 
> 	serialization.format	1
{noformat}

Second difference "Storage Desc Params" is due to deepcopying of parent table StorageDescriptor and not resetting in copied version. First difference is also due to deepcopying. However all tables that are not bucketized contain the "-1" as the value for "Num Buckets". I am wondering whether we should keep the same default value for index tables too.
Hmm.. yeah it make sense to have same default values.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12681575 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Committed to trunk. Thanks, Venki!
[~ashutoshc] sounds like it be good to port this to .14 too.
Committed to 0.14
Updating release version for jiras resolved in 1.0.0 .
This issue has been fixed in Apache Hive 1.0.0. If there is any issue with the fix, please open a new jira to address it.
